sen.j: 大日本国一宮記（だいにほんこくいちのみやき）は群書類従 第二輯 神祇部 巻第二十三 に編纂されている日本国内の一宮一覧で、室町時代の成立とされる。
sen.e: "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" is an Ichinomiya Ichiran (catalogue of high-ranking shrines of Shinto in Japan) which was written in the Muromachi period, and it was collected into "Gunsho-ruiju Collection" (Volume 23, Part of gods, Collection 2).

"Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" is an Ichinomiya Ichiran (catalogue of high-ranking shrines of Shinto in Japan) which was written in the Muromachi period, and it was collected into "Gunsho-ruiju Collection" (Volume 23, Part of gods, Collection 2).

"Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" is an Ichinomiya Ichiran (catalogue of high-ranking shrines of Shinto in Japan) which was written in the Muromachi period, and it was collected into "Gunsho ruiju (Collection of historical documents compiled by Hokiichi HANAWA)" (Volume 23, Part of gods, Collection 2).
sen.cmt: Gunsho ruiju →用語共有に沿い説明記載

sen.j: 諸国一宮の社名、祭神、鎮座地を記した史料は「一宮記」と呼ばれ同種の本が多数存在するが、『大日本国一宮記』はその内の一つである。
sen.e: The historical materials, in which the names of Ichinomiya (high-ranking shrines of provinces), gods and locations are written, are generally called 'Ichinomiya-Ki'; that kind of materials are not rare, and "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" is one of those.

The historical materials, in which the names of Ichinomiya (high-ranking shrines of provinces), gods and locations are written, are generally called 'Ichinomiya-Ki'; that kind of material is not rare, and "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" is one of those.

The historical materials, in which the names of Ichinomiya (high-ranking shrines of provinces), gods and locations are written, are generally called 'Ichinomiya-Ki'; that kind of material is not rare, and "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" is one of those.

sen.j: 『大日本国一宮記』自体にも写本が多数存在する。
sen.e: There remain many copies of "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" as well.
There remain many copies of "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" as well.
There remain many copies of "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" as well.

sen.j: 一宮の研究における重要な資料であり、現代においても巡拝や取材する一宮の選定基準とされることがある。
sen.e: It is an important material for the research on Ichinomiya and still used as a standard for pilgrimage or report.
It is an important material for the research on Ichinomiya and is still used as a standard for pilgrimage or report.
It is an important material for the research on Ichinomiya and is still used as a standard for pilgrimage or report.

sen.j: 解説
sen.e: Comment
Comment
Comment

sen.j: 『大日本国一宮記』は、全国67社の名称、祭神と別称、鎮座地が記載され、最後に 「右諸国一宮神社如此。秘中之神秘也」 との言葉で閉められている。
sen.e: "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" lists the names of sixty-seven shrines of Japan, the names of enshrined gods, the nicknames and the locations; it is closed with the passage "the above are all Ichinomiya shrine of various provinces, those are the mysteries of extreme secrets".

"Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" lists the names of sixty-seven shrines of Japan, the names of enshrined gods, the nicknames and the locations; it is closed with the passage "the above are all Ichinomiya shrine of various provinces, those are the mysteries of extreme secrets".

"Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" lists the names of 67 shrines of Japan, the names of enshrined gods, the nicknames and the locations; it is closed with the passage "the above are all Ichinomiya shrine of various provinces, those are the mysteries of extreme secrets".

sen.j: 記載神社名や割註から分かるとおり本地垂迹の影響が見える。
sen.e: The influence of Honchi-suijaku is read in the names of shrines and notes (Honchi-suijaku is the theory that Japanese gods and the gods of Buddhism, including the Buddha, Bodhisattva and the gods of esoteric Buddhism, are the one and the same).

The influence of Honchi-suijaku is read in the names of shrines and notes (Honchi-suijaku is the theory that Japanese gods and the gods of Buddhism, including the Buddha, Bodhisattva and the gods of esoteric Buddhism, are the one and the same).

The influence of Honji suijaku (Shinto and Buddhist syncretism) is read in the names of shrines and notes (Honchi-suijaku is the theory that Japanese gods and the gods of Buddhism, including the Buddha, Bodhisattva and the gods of esoteric Buddhism, are the one and the same).
sen.cmt: Honji suijaku →用語共有に沿い説明追加

sen.j: また安房国、豊後国では異なる２つの神社を同一社のごとく記載していることから、現地を調査して編纂されたものでは無いことが推測される。
sen.e: Since the book lists two shrines of Awa Province and Bungo Province as one same shrine, it is considered that the writer hadn't gone all the spots for research.
Since the book lists two shrines of Awa Province and Bungo Province as one and the same shrine, it is considered that the writer hadn't gone to all the spots for research.
Since the book lists two shrines of Awa Province and Bungo Province as one and the same shrine, it is considered that the writer hadn't gone to all the spots for research.

sen.j: 鹿児島神社の割註に「兼右云。」とあることから、吉田兼右の在世である16世紀頃に成立したであろうこと、吉田家あるいは吉田家に近い人物が編纂に係わっていることが推測できる。
sen.e: From the note for the Kagoshima-jinja Shrine, "Kanemigi said", it is presumed that the book was written about the sixteenth century which Kanemigi YOSHIDA had been alive, with the cooperation from the Yoshida family or a friend of the family.

From the note for the Kagoshima-jinja Shrine, "Kanemigi said", it is presumed that the book was written about the sixteenth century which Kanemigi YOSHIDA had been alive, with the cooperation from the Yoshida family or a friend of the family.

From the note for the Kagoshima-jinja Shrine, "Kanemigi said", it is presumed that the book was written about the sixteenth century which Kanemigi YOSHIDA had been alive, with the cooperation from the Yoshida family or a friend of the family.

sen.j: 写本が多数存在するが、写本同士で内容が若干異なる場合がある。
sen.e: There remain many copies, and the texts of some copies slightly differ from each other.
There remain many copies, and the texts of some copies slightly differ from each other.
There remain many copies, and the texts of some copies slightly differ from each other.

sen.j: また、『大倭国一宮記』、『日本国一宮記』と題する諸本は内容がほぼ同じで、『大日本国一宮記』の類本と考えられる。
sen.e: "Yamatonokuni Ichinomiya-Ki" and "Nihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" are highly similar to "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" in the contents, so those books are considered to have copied after "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki".
"Yamatonokuni Ichinomiya-Ki" and "Nihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" are highly similar to "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" in content, so those books are considered to have copied "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki".
"Yamatonokuni Ichinomiya-Ki" and "Nihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" are highly similar to "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" in content, so those books are considered to have copied "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki".

sen.j: 大塚統子『「一宮記」の諸系統』では、応安8年（南朝の元号では天授 (日本)元年、1375年）2月24日以前に成立した卜部氏宿禰奥書『諸国一宮神名帳』と『大日本国一宮記』を比較している。
sen.e: "The Various Lines of Ichinomiya-Ki" by Noriko OTSUKA compares "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" with a copy of "Shokoku Ichinomiya Jinmyocho" (Catalogue of High-Ranking Shrines of Provinces) which was copied by Urabe-sukune before 24 February 1375 (according to old lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: 原文に論文著者名がありませんでしたが、そのままでは失礼なので原文訳文とも著者名を加えました。大塚統子「「一宮記」の諸系統」（『中世一宮制の歴史的展開 下』岩田書院2004所収）
sen.e: "The Various Lines of Ichinomiya-Ki" by Noriko OTSUKA compares "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" with a copy of "Shokoku Ichinomiya Jinmyocho" (Catalogue of High-Ranking Shrines of Provinces) which was copied by Urabe-sukune before 24 February 1375.

"The Various Lines of Ichinomiya-Ki" by Noriko OTSUKA compares "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" with a copy of "Shokoku Ichinomiya Jinmyocho" (Catalogue of High-Ranking Shrines of Provinces) which was copied by Urabe-sukune before 3 April 1375.

sen.j: 両書を比較した場合、成立が後となる『大日本国一宮記』が記載を改めたとすると、同一社の神名を書き換えている神社19社の内14社が『延喜式神名帳』の記載神名に基づいて訂正されており、また卜部宿禰奥書『諸国一宮神名帳』では陸奥国一宮と豊後国一宮に式外社が記載されていたものが『大日本国一宮記』では式内社へ変更されている。
sen.e: "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" corrected mistakes of nineteen shrines' names in the copy of "Shokoku Ichinomiya Jinmyocho" (only if the writer had known the copy), and based on "Engi-shiki Jinmyocho" (the Catalogue of High-Ranking Shrines collected in "Engi-shiki") made the fourteen correction of those mistakes; besides it re-categorized some shrines of Mutsu Province and Bungo Province, which the copy of "Shokoku Ichinomiya Jinmyocho" had categorized into Shikigaisha (shrines which hadn't been listed in "Engi-shiki Jinmyocho), into Shikinaisha (time-honored shrines which had been listed in "Engi-shiki Jinmyocho").

"Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" corrected mistakes of nineteen shrines' names in the copy of "Shokoku Ichinomiya Jinmyocho" (only if the writer had known the copy), and based on "Engi-shiki Jinmyocho" (the Catalogue of High-Ranking Shrines collected in "Engi-shiki") made the fourteen corrections of those mistakes; besides it re-categorized some shrines of Mutsu Province and Bungo Province, which the copy of "Shokoku Ichinomiya Jinmyocho" had categorized into Shikigaisha (shrines which hadn't been listed in "Engi-shiki Jinmyocho), into Shikinaisha (time-honored shrines which had been listed in "Engi-shiki Jinmyocho").

"Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" corrected mistakes of 19 shrines' names in the copy of "Shokoku Ichinomiya Jinmyocho" (only if the writer had known the copy), and based on "Engi-shiki Jinmyocho" (the Catalogue of High-Ranking Shrines collected in "Engi-shiki") made the 14 corrections of those mistakes; besides it re-categorized some shrines of Mutsu Province and Bungo Province, which the copy of "Shokoku Ichinomiya Jinmyocho" had categorized into Shikigaisha (shrines which hadn't been listed in "Engi-shiki Jinmyocho), into Shikinaisha (time-honored shrines which had been listed in "Engi-shiki Jinmyocho").

sen.j: この事実等から『「一宮記」の諸系統』では、選者は『延喜式神名帳』の式内社であることを強く意識して編纂に当たったのではないかと考察している。
sen.e: Therefore "The Various Lines of Ichinomiya-Ki" concludes that the writer of "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" intended to classify shrines based on whether it had been listed in "Engi-shiki Jinmyocho" or not.

Therefore "The Various Lines of Ichinomiya-Ki" concludes that the writer of "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" intended to classify shrines based on whether it had been listed in "Engi-shiki Jinmyocho" or not.

Therefore "The Various Lines of Ichinomiya-Ki" concludes that the writer of "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" intended to classify shrines based on whether it had been listed in "Engi-shiki Jinmyocho" or not.

sen.j: しかしながら、この改訂が一宮はどこかと言う事実を追求した成果なのか、あるいは政治的意図があったのかは別の検証が必要であるとも同書では述べている。
sen.e: However, "The Various Lines of Ichinomiya-Ki" also suggests that more research is required to figure out whether the corrections of the mistakes was the result of careful research or the writer had some political intension.

However, "The Various Lines of Ichinomiya-Ki" also suggests that more research is required to figure out whether the corrections of the mistakes were the result of careful research or the writer had some political intension.

However, "The Various Lines of Ichinomiya-Ki" also suggests that more research is required to figure out whether the corrections of the mistakes were the result of careful research or the writer had some political intension.

sen.j: 近世に『一宮記』が参照された際は、『大日本国一宮記』が用いられることが多かった。
sen.e: In the Edo period, "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" was usually quoted as the most popular catalogue among many "Ichinomiya-Ki".
In the Edo period, "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" was usually quoted as the most popular catalog among many "Ichinomiya-Ki".
In the early-modern period, "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki" was usually quoted as the most popular catalog among many "Ichinomiya-Ki".

sen.j: 江戸時代初期の神道者である橘三喜が延宝3年（1675年）から元禄10年（1697年）までの足掛け23年に亘って全国の一宮を巡った際は、『大日本国一宮記』の類本である『吉田一宮記』と『豊葦原一宮記』を携帯して諸国を巡った。
sen.e: Mitsuyoshi TACHIBANA, a Shintoist in the early Edo period, had carried "Yochida Ichinomiya-Ki" and "Toyoashihara Ichinomiya-Ki" (both of those were copied after "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki") to visit Ichinomiya shrines of the whole country, making long tour since 1675 until 1697.

Mitsuyoshi TACHIBANA, a Shintoist in the early Edo period, had carried "Yochida Ichinomiya-Ki" and "Toyoashihara Ichinomiya-Ki" (both of those were copied after "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki") to visit Ichinomiya shrines of the whole country, making a long tour from 1675 until 1697.

Mitsuyoshi TACHIBANA, a Shintoist in the early Edo period, had carried "Yochida Ichinomiya-Ki" and "Toyoashihara Ichinomiya-Ki" (both of those were copied after "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki") to visit Ichinomiya shrines of the whole country, making a long tour over nearly 23 years from 1675 until 1697.

sen.j: また伴信友が天保8年（1837年）に著した『神社思考』では、世の一宮記に書かれている神々は全て『延喜式神名帳』に載っていると記しており、伴信友も『大日本国一宮記』系統の本を参照していたと思われる。
sen.e: Besides, "Jinja Shiko" by Nobutomo BAN (1837) says "Engi-shiki Jinmyocho had already listed all the gods which current Ichinomiya-Ki mention", so Ban seems to have had some Ichinomiya-ki which had been copied after "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki".

Besides, "Jinja Shiko" by Nobutomo BAN (1837) says "Engi-shiki Jinmyocho had already listed all the gods which current Ichinomiya-Ki mention", so Ban seems to have had some Ichinomiya-ki which had been copied after "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki".

Besides, "Jinja Shiko" by Nobutomo BAN (1837) says "Engi-shiki Jinmyocho had already listed all the gods which current Ichinomiya-Ki mention", so Ban seems to have had some Ichinomiya-ki which had been copied after "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki".

sen.j: 『大日本国一宮記』には以下の67社が記載されている。
sen.e: The following is all the sixty-seven shrines listed in "Dainihonkoku Ichinomiya-Ki".

sen.j: 記載順や社名、鎮座地は群書類従版に同じ。
sen.e: The order of the shrines, the shrines' names and the locations are followed the Gunsho-ruiju edition.
The order of the shrines, the shrines' names and the locations follow the Gunsho-ruiju edition.
The order of the shrines, the shrines' names and the locations follow the Gunsho-ruiju edition.

sen.j: また、原文では祭神・別称を漢文で記載しているが、ここでは書き下した。
sen.e: As for the name of the gods and the nickname, although in the original text, those are written in only kanji character, the article's writer converts those to the mix of hiragana and kanji character.
As for the names of the gods and the nicknames, although in the original text they are written in only kanji characters, the article's writer converts those to a mix of hiragana and kanji characters.
